hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Failed Lower Low with Decreasing Selling Pressure
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes (BTC below 200D SMA), a transition to NEUTRAL is signaled when: 1) BTC makes a lower low but closes in top 40% of daily range (hammer-like pattern), 2) 14-day ADX declines below 30 from above 40, and 3) CVD (Cumulative Volume Delta) shows positive divergence (price lower low, CVD higher low). This predicts consolidation followed by 4-7% rally over 8 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear markets end with selling exhaustion. Failed lower lows with improving close indicate sellers losing control. Declining ADX shows trend weakening, while positive CVD divergence reveals accumulation despite lower prices.
entry_conditions: BTC makes 5-day lower low but closes in top 40% of daily range
14-day ADX < 30 AND was >40 within previous 5 days
CVD 5-day low > previous 5-day low while price makes lower low

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes new 5-day low below entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Signal triggers but BTC immediately breaks to new lows (>2% below signal price) within 3 days more than 30% of occurrences.
